p: A total of 553 slaughterhouse workers were sampled in 84 ruminant slaughterhouses. Four slaughterhouses refused to participate in the study. The majority of slaughterhouse workers were men (96.8%). The age of the slaughterhouse workers ranged from 18â€“82 years with a median age of 38 years. The roles in the slaughterhouse included flayers (74.7%), slaughtermen (11.6%), and cleaners/foremen (13.7%). There were 18 female slaughterhouse workers and the role of women within the slaughterhouse differed to men with only one female flayer (5.6%) and the remainder were cleaners (94.4%).
